newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tobishima creditors to accept plan - paper.
newsitem.headline: Tobishima creditors to accept plan - paper.

text.p: Creditors of debt-ridden Tobishima Corp have agreed to accept the construction firm's restructuring plan, which includes a sharp reduction in their claims against Tobishima for its group firms' debts, the Nihon Keizai Shimbun business daily said on Wednesday.
Tobishima and its creditor financial institutions were not immediately available for comment on the report.
Many of its creditors will sign a formal agreement by the end of this month while others are seen joining after April after finalising the details, the paper said.
Under a plan formed last year, Tobishima asked its creditors to reduce their claims against the construction firm for its group companies' debt to 100 billion yen from about 740 billion yen.
There are more than 50 creditor financial institutions, of which Fuji Bank Ltd is the main creditor.
As a result of the agreement, the creditors are expected to absorb a loss of nearly 500 billion yen, the paper said.
